name: I.C.S. | Low table
description: A meeting point between modernity, internationalism and a certain style that nods to the twentieth century: I.C.S. Tavolino is a coffee table made from solid American walnut and veneered poplar plywood with a glass top that is available in three different finishes. Robert Lazzeroni first came up with the idea behind this table in 1999. Like the larger table I.C.S. that shares its name, it is part of a wider collection of furniture suitable for both home and business contexts. It, too, is characterised by the scored texture of its wood, which rests on a base made from satin stainless steel, or, on request, burnished brass.
